benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered: TC01 covers valid transfer from child to parent with 204 status and balance update for both accounts.
TC02 covers optional headers and audit logging of reason and comment.
TC03 covers insufficient credit results in 400.
TC04 covers 404 when child account not found.
TC05 covers 404 when parent account not found.
TC06 covers 400 when missing required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
TC07 covers 400 when childAccountId format is invalid.
TC08 covers extra/unsupported headers are ignored and transfer still succeeds (204).
TC09 covers API unavailable resulting in 503.
TC11 covers header input validation for malicious payload (400/422).
TC12 covers database empty scenario producing 404.
TC13 covers performance with large dataset achieving sub-second response time.
TC14 covers concurrency: only one of multiple concurrent requests succeeds with 204; others fail due to insufficient credit.
TC15 covers invalid/unexpected header formats producing 400/422.
TC16 covers regression: double transfer results in first 204 and second 400.
TC17 covers API backward compatibility: 204 with previous API version.
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error scenario (server or DB failure) is not covered.
Rate limiting/throttling scenarios are not covered.
Caching behavior / headers for PUT (ETag, Cache-Control) are not validated.
Error response bodies content validation (beyond status codes) is not covered.
Partial transfer input formats or transfer amount validation (if supported) are not explicitly tested.
recommendations: Add a test for 500 Internal Server Error to simulate DB/server failures.
Add rate limiting / throttling tests to verify handling of burst requests.
Add tests to validate caching headers on PUT responses (ETag, Cache-Control).
Add tests that assert the exact error payload content for failures (beyond status codes).
Add tests for idempotency/transfer amount semantics if a partial transfer or amount parameter exists, including explicit idempotency behavior.
